com.bill.java.api.models

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bill.java.api.net.ApiResource
      • com.bill.java.api.models.Session

  • public class Session
extends ApiResource
    The Session class represents a user's session credentials and includes all methods for user authentication and fetching session information.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public static Session login(SessionLoginRequestParams sessionLoginRequestParams)
                     throws BDCException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Validates the user credentials for a user to log in to the system. Upon success, the user is able to log in and the session information is stored for future API usage. If the response from the request is unsuccessful, the BDCException is thrown and if an I/O exception occurs, the IOException is thrown.

        For information on calling the method and to check out a sample request and response, see Login.

        Parameters:
        sessionLoginRequestParams - parameters required to make the request. For more information, see SessionLoginRequestParams.
        Returns:
        a Session object containing the response values from the API
        Throws:
        BDCException - is thrown when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request

      • ListOrgs

        public static java.util.List<OrgInfo> ListOrgs()
                                        throws BDCException,
                                               java.io.IOException
        Lists the organizations that the current user has permission to access.

        For information on calling the method and to check out a sample request and response, see List Organizations.

        Returns:
        an OrgInfo object which lists the ID and name of the organizations the user has access to login to.
        Throws:
        BDCException - is thrown when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request
        See Also:
        OrgInfo

      • logout

        public static java.lang.Boolean logout()
                                throws BDCException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Logs out the user that is currently signed in. Upon success, deletes the session information that was stored. If the response from the request is unsuccessful, the BDCException is thrown and if an I/O exception occurs, the IOException is thrown.

        For information on calling the method and to check out a sample request and response, see Logout.

        Returns:
        true if the user successfully logged out
        Throws:
        BDCException - is thrown when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request

      • getSessionInfo

        public static SessionInfo getSessionInfo()
                                  throws BDCException,
                                         java.io.IOException
        Gets the organization ID and user ID of the user that is currently logged in.

        For information on calling the method and to check out a sample request and response, see Get Session Information.

        Returns:
        the SessionInfo object which includes the organization ID and user ID
        Throws:
        BDCException - is thrown when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request

      • requestMFAChallenge

        public static MFAChallenge requestMFAChallenge(MFAChallengeRequestParams mfaChallengeRequestparams)
                                        throws BDCException,
                                               java.io.IOException
        Generates and returns a challenge ID, and sends a token to the user’s registered mobile device in order to Multi Factor Authenticate (MFA) the user. The session needs to be MFA trusted to call the methods that pay bills, send network invitations, send vendor invitations, and manage vendor bank accounts.

        For information on calling the method and to check out a sample request and response, see Create MFA Challenge ID.

        Parameters:
        mfaChallengeRequestparams - the MFAChallengeRequestParams, which contains an argument to determine whether the token needs to be sent to the primary mobile device [value = false] or back up mobile device [value = true]
        Returns:
        an MFAChallenge object which includes a challenge ID
        Throws:
        BDCException - is thrown when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request
        See Also:
        MFA Workflow

      • MFAAuthenticate

        public static MFA MFAAuthenticate(MFAAuthenticateRequestParams mfaAuthenticationRequestParams)
                           throws BDCException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) is used to validate the token sent to the user’s mobile device via the mfaChallenge method. This method validates the challenge ID, token that was sent to the users mobile device, device ID, and the name that was given to the machine at the time of generating the challenge ID. Upon success, the user’s session is marked as a trusted. If the rememberMe parameter is set to true, the trusted session expires in 30 days. Else, it expires when the user logs out.

        For information on calling the method and to check out a sample request and response, see Multi Factor Authentication.

        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticationRequestParams - the MFAAuthenticateRequestParams, which contains the MFA challenge ID, the token that was sent to the user's mobile device, the device ID defined by the user to identify the MFA device, the machine name defined by the user to describe the MFA device, and the rememberMe argument, which determines if the MFA ID needs to be trusted after the session is over.
        Returns:
        an MFA object which includes an MFA ID
        Throws:
        BDCException - is thrown when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request
        See Also:
        MFA Workflow

      • getMFAStatus

        public static MFAStatus getMFAStatus(MFAStatusRequestParams mfaStatusRequestParams)
                              throws BDCException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Checks the Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) session status of the current user.

        For information on calling the method and to check out a sample request and response, see MFA Status.

        Parameters:
        mfaStatusRequestParams - the MFAStatusRequestParams, which contains the MFA ID that is returned after successfully calling the MFAAuthenticate method, and the device ID defined by the user to identify the MFA device
        Returns:
        an MFAStatus object which includes the isTrusted boolean field describing if the session trusted or not
        Throws:
        BDCException - is thrown when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request
        See Also:
        MFA Workflow
